alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 7:57AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Recent rainfall has combined with melting snow to raise water levels on the Sweetwater River. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Sweetwater River around Sweetwater Station will continue to run near or above bankfull, and low-land flooding near the river is likely through at least midweek. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by recent rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying, poor drainage, and marshy areas. The stage on the Sweetwater River near Sweetwater Station stood at 6.4 feet at 7am Monday, May 15, and a slow rise to between 6.5 and 7.0 feet is expected early this week. Minor flood stage is 7 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 745 AM MDT, gauge reports indicated minor flooding of agricultural land due to recent rainfall and snowmelt. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of southeast Fremont County from around Sweetwater Station downstream toward areas north of Jeffrey City
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
